com.paydiant.android.ui.service.security

Class UserLoginListenerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paydiant.android.ui.service.security.UserLoginListenerAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IUserLoginExtendedListener, IUserLoginListener

    public class UserLoginListenerAdapter
extends Object
implements IUserLoginExtendedListener
    This class provides an empty implementation for IUserLoginListener. Any classes that wants to use only a subset of the listener methods can override the relevant methods and use it as the interface implementation. 

      UserLoginListenerAdapter userLoginListenerAdapter = new UserLoginListenerAdapter() {
      @Override
      public void onSuccess() {
      }

      @Override
      public void onError(PaydiantException e) {
      }
  };
  iUserLoginService.setUserLoginListener(userLoginListenerAdapter);
    Note: App developers are encouraged to use the ListenerAdapter implementations whenever possible as the Listener interfaces might get updated with new functionality/methods from one SDK release to the other. Therefore using a ListenerAdapter will make sure that there wont be any compilation issues due to unimplemented methods during a SDK upgrade.

    Author:
    Paydiant

      • onSuccess

        public void onSuccess(Map<String,String> additionalAttributes)
        Description copied from interface: IUserLoginExtendedListener
        This callback method gets invoked after a successful login. Any additional information returned thorough the login process will be available through the additionalAttributes parameter.

        Note: Use only this method or the IUserLoginListener.onSuccess() method to handle successful login callbacks.
        Specified by:
        onSuccess in interface IUserLoginExtendedListener
        Parameters:
        additionalAttributes - Any additional information related to the device or login as key value pairs.
        See Also:
        ISecurityManagerFacade.getAdditionalAttributes()
